title: FireRedTTS-1S: An Upgraded Streamable Foundation Text-to-Speech System
author: Hao-Han Guo, Kun Xie, Yi-Chen Wu, Feng-Long Xie, Xu Tang, Yao Hu, Xiaohongshu
relevance_why: This paper presents an upgraded text-to-speech synthesis system, which utilizes advanced machine learning techniques that could be applicable to Haohe Liu's research in audio generation and enhancement.
background: Developing a text-to-speech system that can generate high-quality speech audio in real-time using a two-step approach: decoding text into semantic tokens and then translating those into acoustic signals.
contribution: FireRedTTS-1S introduces a streaming foundation text-to-speech system that improves synthesis quality and reduces latency, achieving real-time generation with a latency under 150ms.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional TTS systems often struggle with real-time generation and voice cloning quality.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances synthesis quality by using a semantic language model and a super-resolution causal acoustic codec, improving both intelligibility and speaker similarity.

key_innovation: Combines a semantic-aware speech tokenizer and a causal audio codec to efficiently produce high-quality speech in streaming mode.
real_world_impact: This upgraded TTS system has the potential to significantly enhance interactive voice applications, making synthesized speech sound more natural and responsive in real-time.

new_terms.semantic tokens: **Semantic tokens** are discrete representations of the semantic information in speech, which are generated from input text and can be used for voice synthesis.
new_terms.super-resolution causal acoustic codec: **Super-resolution causal acoustic codec** is a model designed to convert lower-resolution audio inputs into higher-resolution outputs while maintaining the acoustic integrity of speech.

open_sourcing: The inference code and demo page are available at https://fireredteam.github.io/demos/firered_tts_1s
